title: Should the Karen Matthews case be RE-OPENED? New Channel 5 documentary investigates claims by former neighbours
text:
The real Karen Matthews (Photo: Copyright unknown) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
She is, of course, branded as Britain's wost mum. But the ex-neighbours of Karen Matthews believe the convict wasn't the brainchild of her now-infamous scam. 
In fact, according to a new Channel 5 documentary which will air on Tuesday at 10pm, those who knew the disgraced matriarch believe she was acting under instruction from somebody else - and that justice is yet to catch up with them. 
Residents of Dewsbury Moor insist that neither Karen nor her accomplice, Michael Donovan, were intelligent enough to organise the plot, in which they said 9 year-old Shannon Matthews had been abducted. 
Now, former friends of them both will reveal their theories - and urge Karen to come clean. Karen Matthews pictured on March 6th. 2008 during the period when her daughter Shannon was missing (Photo: Daily Mirror) The now-infamous picture of Shannon Matthews, which was used by police (Photo: PA) 
One of those people is Julie Bushby, who has remained friends with the mum-of-eight. She says Matthews does not have the intelligence to have thought up such a cynical plan, that many believed was hatched to cash in on reward money. 
And the shop worker believes others involved in the false kidnap have created a shroud of silence around the case to protect themselves from prosecution. 
Julie said: “I think there are at least three other people who know far more than they let on. This is a horrible conspiracy of silence and it’s time for those people to speak out and tell the truth. Read More Julie doesn't believe Karen masterminded the kidnap plot (Photo: Tony Spencer) Karen Matthews was convicted of kidnapping her own daughter (Photo: Daily Mirror) Read More 
“Karen was not intelligent enough to think it up on her own. I’m not saying at all what she did was right, or that she was totally innocent, but she’s not evil. 
“Karen is a child in adult’s clothing and easily used and manipulated. 
“This was never about the reward money, something else was going on. We need the truth now.” 
Matthews also insisted in a Mirror interview there were “others” involved in the kidnap of her daughter on the estate where she lived in Dewsbury, West Yorks, and wants police to reinvestigate. Read More Who are Karen Matthews and Julie Bushby? Karen at the time of her daughter Shannon's disappearance 
Julie, who is played by Sheridan Smith in BBC drama The Moorside about nine-year-old Shannon’s kidnap in March 2008, admits she is obsessed by the crime. 
She admitted she was taken in by Matthews’ appalling lies during the hunt for the youngster, but started to have her suspicions after she was found alive. 
Julie added: “When Shannon was missing I was busy in the community centre sorting out the posters and supporting Karen. 
"I was more concerned about finding Shannon and obsessed with keeping her name in the news. Read More Karen and her partner Craig Meehan when Shannon was missing (Photo: Daily Mirror) Read More How did police uncover Karen Matthews' sordid plot of fake kidnapping her own daughter? 
“But after she was found alive I started to look at what had gone on. 
“I got straight on the computer to look at pictures of Karen and how she was when she made appeals. 
"The first one seemed genuine but the one where she held a teddy bear up was weird. It just wasn’t right. 
“Then you start thinking about how she was in the centre, laughing and joking when the cameras were not there. Read More
